claim: 1977 / 1978 / 1989 season have more than 26 point , less than 18 game , and exactly 13 loss
resp:
Here is the step-by-step reasoning:

1. Identify the seasons to be checked (1977, 1978, 1989).
2. For each season, check if the number of games (games) in the corresponding row equals 13 (less than 18 as per the claim).
3. If the number of games is indeed 13, then check if the number of losses (losses) in the same row equals exactly 13.
4. If the number of losses is indeed 13, then check if the points (points) in the same row are more than 26 and less than 18. Since the number of games is 13 which is less than 18, this condition doesn't apply for these seasons.
5. If any of the above conditions are not met for any season, then the claim is false.
6. If all conditions are met for all specified seasons, then the claim is true.

The relevant cells for each season would be:

For 1977: { "row_index": 20, "column_name": "games" }, { "row_index": 20, "column_name": "losses" }, { "row_index": 20, "column_name": "points" }

If yes, then skipped the points condition as games = 13 < 18. If any conditions were not met for any season, claim is false. If all conditions are met for all specified seasons, claim is true.",
